entry.title: Asset Management in SAP Cloud ERP Private | 2025 Release
entry.content:
Welcome to our deep dive into the latest advancements for Asset Management in SAP Cloud ERP Private 2025 release. I am thrilled to walk you through the key highlights for this release, collected with close collaboration with our product management teams focused on asset management.

This collection is part of SAP features released on October 8, 2025.

You can find an overview of selected innovation highlights across all lines of business in the blog post below:

SAP Cloud ERP Private 2025 Product Release Highlights by Bert Schulze

In this blog post, we will explore updates on maintenance management apps, inspection checklist, further integration with Asset Performance Management, enhancements for Resource Scheduling (43R), and more.

This update introduces new capabilities to streamline your maintenance processes, enhance quality control, and improve operational efficiency. It is particularly relevant for maintenance planners, technicians, and other professionals involved on maintenance operations.

Table of Contents:

  • Updates on Perform Maintenance Jobs Fiori app (F5104A)
  • Updates on Manage Maintenance Orders app (F5241)
  • Updates on Manage Maintenance Planning Buckets (F3888A)‚Äã
  • Updates on Manage Inspection Checklists app (F6607)
  • Inspection checklist creation based on material in the maintenance order
  • Harmonize Document Management (HDM) in maintenance request apps
  • Work pack creation over the maintenance order lifecycle
  • Enabled maintenance event field in maintenance notification
  • Barcode-based filtering in the Find Maintenance orders app
  • Using SAP Fiori Maintain Default Values app for auto population while creating new work permit objects
  • Ability to Resubmit Action Required Subphase Requests in My Maintenance Requests app
  • Further integration with SAP Asset Performance Management (APM)
  • Enhancements in Resource Scheduling (RSH)
  • Spatial Asset Management
  • More information and links

Updates on Perform Maintenance Jobs Fiori app (F5104A) 

In the Perform Maintenance Jobs Fiori app (F5104A), users can find new features and customizing settings. Below, we present some highlights. Find in the SAP Help Portal the complete list of new features: Enhancements for Perform Maintenance Jobs App | SAP Help Portal

Display of long texts and documents

Failure Mode and Failure Effect fields now support long text display and document attachments directly within the app. This enhancement improves visibility into failure context during job execution. Technicians and planners gain immediate access to detailed failure information, improving diagnostic accuracy and reducing time spent searching for documentation.

Display of long texts and documents

Storage location and plant change for goods movement

Technicians can now change storage locations for planned components and plants for unplanned components during goods movement. A new customizing flag enables this functionality, and authorization checks are enforced to ensure compliance.

This feature increases flexibility in material handling, especially in dynamic field environments where technicians may need to adapt to local inventory constraints.

Storage location and plant change for goods movement

Barcode scan for unplanned material movement

A barcode scanning feature allows technicians to quickly add unplanned components by scanning material codes. This functionality is available directly in the Unplanned Components session as well as in the Add Unplanned Component popup and streamlines material handling during execution. Barcode scanning reduces manual input errors and speeds up the process of adding materials, especially in high-volume or time-sensitive maintenance tasks.

Barcode scan for unplanned material movement

Calendar view for job assignments

A new calendar view provides a visual representation of assigned jobs. Users can toggle between calendar and list views, filter by responsibility, and identify parallel assignments. Color coding indicates job status. Start and end dates are based on scheduled times, and overlapping operations are supported for better planning. The calendar view enables planners and technicians to manage time more effectively, prioritize tasks, and ensure timely execution of maintenance activities.

Calendar view for job assignments

Modernized time recording dialog

The new interface of time recording dialog prioritizes the most frequently used fields, according to work status, type of activity, long confirmation text and final confirmation flag.

When multiple employees record actual work, the system automatically calculates the remaining work based on cumulative entries. Additionally, users can modify or delete entries for additional employees, ensuring flexibility in time management.

Cross-app navigation via ‚Äúrelated apps‚Äù

The object page now includes a ‚Äúrelated apps‚Äù section for seamless navigation to associated applications such as Print Order, Work Packs, Maintenance Scheduling Board, and more.

Navigation is controlled via semantic objects and business catalogs assigned to user roles. Only authorized entries will be available for the user. Cross-app navigation reduces context switching and improves user efficiency by enabling quick access to related functions.

Cross-app navigation via ‚Äúrelated apps‚Äù

Customizing control parameters

A new customizing framework replaces legacy controls for the Perform Maintenance Jobs app. It allows configuration per order type and planning plant combination. Migration to the new framework is automated via XPRA (ASM_XPRA_CONV_PMJ_CTRLP) during upgrades, with manual adjustments required for complex plant mappings. These adjustments will be needed, for example, for cases where multiple maintenance plant configuration existed for old data and have now to be mapped to single planning plant.‚Äã

This enhancement improves configuration flexibility and ensures consistent behavior across different maintenance scenarios.

Find more information here: New Customizing Activity for Perform Maintenance Jobs App | SAP Help Portal

Display of associated work permits

The 2025 release introduces the ability to display associated work permits directly within the Perform Maintenance Jobs app. As pre-requisite, the user must mark operation relevant for the work permit using the Manage Work Permits app. On the list page, two new filter groups in the Perform Maintenance Jobs app allows users to identify operations with work permit relevance or if it has work permit.

On the object page, a dedicated ‚ÄúWork Permits‚Äù section displays the current processing status of each permit, including work permit type, associated technical object, and attachments of the work permit. This integration improves compliance with safety protocols by making permit data readily accessible during job execution.

Check more details here: Integration of Work Permits in Perform Maintenance Jobs App | SAP Help Portal

Display of associated work permits

Confirmation scenario cooperation‚Äã

This release introduces a new cooperation confirmation scenario, designed to ensure that supporting technicians are aware of their participation in maintenance job history.

Now it is possible to generate a dynamic QR code, that allows a maintenance technician to record time confirmation on behalf of another one. The QR code is encrypted, valid for 90 seconds, and can optionally include a confirmation text. Static QR codes are also supported for long-term authentication, with traffic light indicators showing their validity status.

Find out how to implement this new feature here: Recording Cooperation With Other Technicians | SAP Help Portal

Confirmation scenario cooperation

Enablement of a verification process

The new verification confirmation scenario in the Perform Maintenance Jobs app enables a dual-control (four-eyes) principle for maintenance execution. This allows a second technician to verify the correctness of a performed job before final time confirmation is posted.

Verification can be planned at task list or order operation level, with indicators set as optional or required. Technicians use dynamic or static QR codes to authenticate verification. If verification is marked as required, the system blocks final confirmation until at least one verification entry is recorded. The verification status is visible in job lists and history, and multiple verifications are supported.

Find the implementation details here: Verification of Maintenance Jobs | SAP Help Portal

Enablement of a verification process - part I

Enablement of a verification process - part II

Updates on Manage Maintenance Orders app (F5241)

SAP S/4HANA 2025 brings a series of functional and usability improvements to the Manage Maintenance Orders app (F5241). These updates streamline order handling, improve visibility, and support more flexible planning and execution.

You can check more details and complete list of new features for this app in the SAP Help Portal: Enhancements for Manage Maintenance Orders App | SAP Help Portal

Displaying the document flow

Users can now access the document flow of a maintenance order directly from the order detail page via Functions ‚Üí Open Document Flow, which opens the IW12 (Display Document Flow) application. This provides better traceability of linked documents.

Displaying the document flow

Creating a task list from a maintenance order

A new Create Task List button on the Operations and Resources tab allows users to generate task lists from selected operations and suboperations. The system proposes default values from the order and supports copying components, services, and attachments. The task list is not auto linked but can be manually assigned later.

Reassigning components and lean services

Components and lean services can now be reassigned between operations within the same order. This supports flexible resource allocation and simplifies adjustments during planning.

Cancelling the 'Do Not Execute' status

The system status NCMP (Do Not Execute) can now be cancelled directly from the list view or detail page using the Change Status button, allowing planners to reactivate previously blocked orders.

Cancelling the 'Do Not Execute' status

Changing scheduling details in list view

A new Change Scheduling button enables bulk updates to scheduling fields such as priority, basic start/finish, and assignment to maintenance events or revisions, directly from the list view. This includes the possibility to manage the assignment of the orders to a maintenance event or a revision.‚Äã

Changing scheduling details in list view

Updates on Manage Maintenance Planning Buckets app (F3888A)

The 2025 release introduces significant functional enhancements to the Manage Maintenance Planning Buckets app (F3888A), specifically designed to improve operational control and visibility in asset management scenarios.

A key enhancement is the ability to revert system statuses for planning buckets. With the new release, planners can now use the Change Status action to revert statuses (Technically Completed, Do Not Execute, and Deletion Flag) directly from the planning bucket detail page. This allows for greater flexibility in managing maintenance workflows, especially in cases where planning decisions need to be adjusted post-status assignment.

Change Status action to revert statuses

Another functional enhancement is the introduction of progress micro charts for event-based planning buckets. Two new columns (Completed Orders and Completed Notifications) have been added to the app‚Äôs results list. These columns feature micro charts that visualize the ratio of completed items to total assigned items, offering planners a concise and immediate view of maintenance progress across events.

These enhancements collectively improve the planner‚Äôs ability to manage maintenance events dynamically, reduce administrative overhead, and maintain accurate lifecycle tracking of maintenance activities.

Find out more here: Enhancements for Manage Maintenance Planning Buckets (New Version) App | SAP Help Portal

Two new columns (Completed Orders and Completed Notifications)

Updates on Manage Inspection Checklists app (F6607)

The 2025 release significantly improves the performance of the Manage Inspection Checklists app (F6607). Benchmark comparisons show up to 82% reduction in response times for key actions such as result recording and usage decision processing. These optimizations enhance responsiveness in wide-area network (WAN) environments.

Functional enhancements in the app include:

  • Implementation of the column ‚ÄúNumber of Attachments‚Äù in the Inspection Lot tab and the Inspection Characteristics tab.
  • Cross-app navigation via a new action button for Display Results History
  • Enhancement of the Inspection Method, that allow users to navigate to the corresponding inspection method using a smart link.
  • New column Test Equipment 

These improvements accelerate checklist processing, reduce latency in high-volume environments, and support better decision-making through enhanced visibility and navigation.

Find out more in the presentation attached to the SAP Roadmap Explorer and Enhancements for Manage Inspection Checklists App | SAP Help Portal

Updates on Manage Inspection Checklists app (F6607)

Inspection checklist creation based on material in the maintenance order

The new release enables material-based checklist inspection for single or multiple material components that have no technical object master record. The inspection checklist process works for materials with and without serial numbers. The new feature is relevant, for example:

  • When spare parts need to be inspected before using or installing with respect to their condition or functionality
  • For maintenance process or service with Advanced Execution regarding dedicated serialized material
  • For refurbed serialized material by using a refurbishment order

It is possible to enable the material-based checklist inspection via the business function LOG_EAM_CHECKLIST.  The new checklist indicator shows options such as ‚Äúno checklist‚Äù, ‚Äúchecklist without material planning‚Äù and ‚ÄúX checklist‚Äù.

The new feature eliminates the restriction of inspection checklist process for single technical objects. Instead, allow checklists for a quantity of material pieces. Moreover, it provides cluster functionalities for the material serial number checklists.

Find more information and implementation details at Checklist for Material Components | SAP Help Portal

Harmonize Document Management (HDM) in maintenance request apps

The new release has introduced a powerful enhancement for managing attachments across its maintenance-related Fiori apps: Harmonized Document Management (HDM). This feature enables seamless integration and flexible configuration of attachment handling processes across multiple document management frameworks, including Document Management System (DMS), Generic Object Services (GOS), and ArchiveLink.

HDM is now available in the following SAP Fiori apps: Create Maintenance Request (F1511A), Screen Maintenance Requests (F4072), My Maintenance Requests (F4513), Find Maintenance Notification (F2071) (view-only access to attachments).

By enabling HDM in these apps, organizations can harmonize the attachment lifecycle across different backend services, ensuring consistency and reducing complexity in document handling.

Check Harmonized Documents in Maintenance Request Apps | SAP Help Portal for more.

Harmonize Document Management (HDM) in maintenance request apps

Work pack creation over the maintenance order lifecycle

Lifecycle integration

Work pack creation is now supported across the entire maintenance order lifecycle, including both phase-enabled and non-phase-enabled processes. This enhancement allows planners and technicians to group operations into work packs at any stage, from order creation to business completion.

Phase-based processing includes stages such as initiation, planning, scheduling, execution, and post-execution. Non-phase-based processing follows a simplified order flow.

Customizing enhancements

New customizing options allow configuration of work pack types with phase and subphase and system status qualifiers. These qualifiers define inclusion or exclusion conditions for operations and orders:

  • Phase/subphase qualifiers for phase-enabled processes
  • System status qualifiers for non-phase-enabled processes

All conditions within a qualifier table must be met for inclusion in a work pack. This logic ensures precise control over which operations are grouped.

Learn more in the presentation file available on SAP Road Map Explorer

Work pack creation over the maintenance order lifecycle

Enabled maintenance event field in maintenance notification

The newly enabled maintenance event field allows users to assign a maintenance event directly to a maintenance notification. The maintenance event field allows users to filter, view, and assign maintenance notifications based on a maintenance event in SAP Fiori apps Screen Maintenance Requests (F4072)‚Äã, My Maintenance Requests (F4513), as well as WebDynpro apps and Maintenance Notification API. In both SAP Fiori apps, value help is available for selecting events, and once selected, the notification dates are auto filled.

This update brings users improved data consistency, enhanced filtering options, and reduced manual efforts and errors.

Enabled maintenance event field in maintenance notification

Barcode-based filtering in the Find Maintenance orders app

The 2025 release introduces a barcode scanning capability in the Find Maintenance Orders app (F2175), enabling automated filtering based on multiple attributes embedded in a scan code. This enhancement allows users to scan a QR code containing structured data, such as order number, work center, and technical object, and have the app automatically populate filter fields.

This feature speeds up order lookup, reduces manual entry errors, and supports integration with existing barcode systems, ideal for technicians working in fast-paced or mobile environments.

Find more information here: QR Code Scan Function for Filters in Find Maintenance Orders App | SAP Help Portal

Barcode-based filtering in the Find Maintenance orders app

Using SAP Fiori Maintain Default Values app for auto population while creating new work permit objects

SAP Cloud ERP Private 2025 introduces the ability to auto populate key fields (such as planning plant, technical object, and maintenance plant) when creating new Permit to Work objects using the Maintain Default Values Fiori app. These defaults are automatically applied in creation dialogs and filter fields across related apps, including work permits, safety certificates, and templates.

When multiple default values exist, the system uses the first entry. These values are also auto populated in filter fields across apps like Manage Work Permit, Manage Safety Certificate, and Permit to Work Overview for Plant Manager.

This feature reduces manual input, ensures consistency across permit-related processes, and speeds up creation and filtering, especially useful for users managing permits across multiple operational contexts.

Using SAP Fiori Maintain Default Values app for auto population while creating new work permit objects

Ability to resubmit action required subphase requests in My Maintenance Requests app (F4513)

In My Maintenance Requests (F4513) app, users can now view, edit, and resubmit maintenance requests which are in action required subphase, created by other users for an approval. This is helpful when the creator of the maintenance request is not available to provide the required information.

You can enable this functionality by using the business function  LOG_EAM_MY_MAINT_REQ_CREATDBY  (My Maintenance Request: Created By). Earlier, only the user who created the request was able to edit it and submit the maintenance request.

This update empowers multiple users to manage and resubmit maintenance requests, reducing reliance on a single individual. Moreover, ensures continuity and flexibility in operations despite user absence, turnover, or retirement.

Further integration with SAP Asset Performance Management (APM)

Enhanced APM data visibility

The 2025 deepens integration between SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition and SAP Asset Performance Management (APM) through enhancements to the Find Technical Objects app (F2072). A new section displays APM recommendations, indicators, and assessments directly within the app. Semantic object navigation links allow users to explore technical objects from APM to review indicators, manage RCM/FMEA assessments, and access SAP S/4HANA measuring points.  Now, risk and criticality information is available directly on the header and it is possible to have and overview of assigned APM recommendations to the technical object.

This integration allows maintenance planners and reliability engineers to access performance metrics and risk evaluations directly within the technical object context, supporting proactive decision-making.

Enhanced APM data visibility

Failure data relationship for failure mode and failure effect

A key enhancement is the ability to use APM failure data relationships to select Failure Effects and Failure Modes during maintenance request creation and notification updates. These selections are enriched with long texts and attachments, providing full context for the failure scenario.

When a Failure Mode is selected, the system automatically assigns the corresponding task list to the maintenance request. This ensures that the correct procedures are followed based on historical failure data and APM recommendations.

This functionality is available in:

  • Create Maintenance Request (F1511A): Users can invoke the ‚ÄúGet Recommended Failure Effects‚Äù or ‚ÄúGet Recommended Failure Modes‚Äù dialog, which requires a technical object to be specified.
  • Screen Maintenance Requests (F4072): Failure Mode selection dynamically updates the assigned task list.
  • Perform Maintenance Jobs (F5104A): During notification changes, users can select Failure Effects and Modes via APM data, with a dialog showing detailed descriptions and attachments.

Failure data relationship for failure mode and failure effect

Find more information in the SAP Road Map Explorer. Check for regular updates on Asset Performance Management (APM) with Kate Dowle's blog posts and the link collection. 

Enhancements in Resource Scheduling (RSH)

The 2025 release introduces a broad set of usability and functional improvements across the Resource Scheduling (RSH) applications. 

New features in the Manage Schedules app

Rescheduling with a reason: You can move operations from a frozen, in-execution, or closed schedule to another schedule. This gives you greater transparency as you can record the reasons for rescheduling and include a comment. 

Filter for all available fields in list view: You can now filter data for all the fields in the list view showing the operations. This gives you full flexibility for working with the operation data in all the phases (planning, finalization, tracking execution, and reviewing).

Key improvements on Resource Scheduling - 1

 Redesigned schedule header: The design of the Manage Schedules header was improved to enhance usability with clearer labels and buttons and more compact presentation of the information.

New features in the Maintenance Scheduling Board app

Instant assignment of person responsible: You can now instantly assign the person responsible or the person to carry out the work to order operations when you choose them from the search results.

Key improvements on Resource Scheduling - 2

Joule integration for Maintenance Scheduling

Joule acts as a copilot, streamlining access to planning tools and reducing the need for manual navigation across SAP Fiori launchpad. It supports faster decision-making, reduces time spent searching for data, and improves responsiveness in dynamic maintenance environments.

The new release introduces Joule integration into Resource Scheduling apps, enabling conversational access to navigation. Joule can now respond to queries related to maintenance planning, provide contextual information, and offer direct links to relevant RSH applications, such as Manage Schedules, Maintenance Scheduling Board, or Work Center Utilization.

Joule Integration for Maintenance Scheduling 

 Key improvements

Accessing the Manage Work Center Utilization app from SAP Fiori Launchpad: A dedicated tile now allows direct access to the Manage Work Center Utilization app, improving navigation efficiency for planners.

Enabling integration of the Service with Advanced Execution service process: RSH apps now support billable maintenance orders from the Service with Advanced Execution service process. Service-specific fields (for example service order, item, product) can be used in filters and displayed in columns.

Key improvements on Resource Scheduling - 3

More flexibility when working with date ranges: In multiple apps, you can select the timeframe required more quickly. Based on the current date, you can choose a number of upcoming days, weeks, months, for example.

Clearer order selection in Gantt Charts: In the Gantt charts for Manage Maintenance Schedule for Orders and for Assets, if you selected the shape for an order or for multiple orders and then use the checkbox to select a different order, the shapes are deselected and vice versa.

Key improvements on Resource Scheduling - 4


Smart links for showing key data and enhanced navigation: Objects are shown as hyperlinks that you can follow to see a compact set of key data in a dialog window. Smart links are available in multiple apps for objects such as orders, operations, functional locations, equipment, and maintenance events. Users can also add personalized links to navigate to other apps.

Assigning team members to multiple teams: Team members can now be assigned to more than one team. A key user can configure the system so that a warning appears instead of an error message when person assigning team members tries to assign a team member to more than one team. The warning can be ignored.

Key improvements on Resource Scheduling - 5

Improved visibility of order and operation status: You can display the readiness status to easily identify whether a maintenance order is time-critical, whether the required materials and services are available, and whether the order has already been submitted for scheduling. This is possible not just at the level of orders but also for order operations.

Key improvements on Resource Scheduling - 6

Spatial Asset Management

Creating follow-on notifications for linear assets

This update enables the creation of follow-on maintenance notifications for linear assets with enhanced data continuity. Two scenarios are supported:

In the first, a follow-on notification is created in reference to a maintenance order. The system automatically transfers linear fields from the order header to the notification header, ensuring that asset-specific data is preserved across documents.

In the second scenario, a new notification is created based on an existing one, without establishing a relationship between the two of them. Even without linkage, the system copies all relevant data (including linear fields) from the source to the target notification. This approach supports flexible reuse of contextual data while maintaining document independence.

 Copying linear fields from maintenance notification header to maintenance order

Now it is possible to copy linear fields from maintenance notification header to maintenance order. When the notification is used as the reference object in the order header, linear fields are directly transferred to the order header. This ensures consistent asset data throughout the maintenance lifecycle.

Alternatively, when the notification is not the reference object in order header, the system transfers linear fields to the order‚Äôs object list. This indirect propagation maintains data integrity and supports flexible order creation workflows.

Creating geo-objects for notifications and orders based on phases and subphases

The 2025 release introduces geo-enablement for maintenance notifications and orders using the Geographical Enablement Framework (GEF). Notifications can now be visualized on a map based on their processing context, phase, and sub-phase.

Configuration involves defining Geo-Objects for different phases, enriching them with new fields such as Notification Processing Context, Phase Code, and Sub-Phase Code. Business Layers are created for each phase of the notification and rendered dynamically based on zoom level, allowing different geometries to be displayed depending on the scale.

These layers are integrated into the Spatial Data Explorer UI, enabling users to navigate hierarchies and view asset locations directly on the map. This enhancement improves spatial awareness and supports more informed decision-making in asset operations.

 

More information / additional links

Thanks for reading this blog post. Stay ahead by following the latest updates with the PSCC_Enablement tag in SAP Community.

Learn more about Asset Management in SAP Cloud ERP Private with our videos and blog posts:

  • Expert Talk: Inspection Checklist in Maintenance Management ‚Äì SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition
  • Expert Talk: Getting Started with Phase Model in Maintenance Management
  • Asset Management in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition 2023 FPS03 Release
  • Asset Management in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition | 2023 FPS02 Release
  • Asset Management in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition | 2023 FPS01 Release
  • Asset Management in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition 2023
  • Highlights for Asset Management in SAP S/4HANA Cloud, private edition and SAP S/4HANA | 2022 Release
  • Highlights for Asset Management in SAP S/4HANA 2021

For more information on SAP Cloud ERP Private, check out the following links:

  • The Link Collection for Asset Management
  • SAP Cloud ERP Private page
  • SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition | SAP Community
  • Inside SAP S/4HANA Cloud
  • Best practices for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition
  • Help Portal Product Page‚ÄØ
  • What's New | SAP Help Portal

entry.title: flow control between exception sub process and main flow: SAP CPI-IS
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

I have an iflow Where I have used the main flow to call a local process and defined the exception sub process to capture the exceptions within that local process. The exception sub process is configured to end with a end message step and before that step a content modifier is used to mark the message as failed explicitly, using the property - SAP_MarkMessageAsFailed = true.

However, I am seeing that when an exception occurs in the main flow, it  calls the local process and it goes to the exception sub process defined in that local process.
The  exception sub process works as expected - format a custom csv message, sends to an external http receiver using request reply and calls the end step. But, even after ending the message (and along with SAP_MarkMessageAsFailed = true.) it still passes the control back to main flow. And surprisingly, it does not execute the flow step immediately after the step where it failed in the main flow/process. It skips so many steps and all of a sudden picks a router step to execute. 
Is there a easy way to stop the message processing when it comes back from local process/ sub exception process?
And I am not sure why it is executing a router step which is far away from the actual failed step.

Thanks
Sugata
Please see the images attached.

entry.title: Actual Supplier information in HU_VAT_DCL Hungary 2565M
entry.content:
Dear all,

We have a requirement from Hungarian client where texpenses claimed by employee and posted as an invoice with employee as a vendor must be reported under actual supplier name and it's tax ID in 65M pages section of VAT return.

We tried to achieve the same with posting invoice and updating alternate information in additional document texts, additional address data, alternative payee. However, non of the approaches worked for 2565M VAT Return: the report is still displaying employee information.

Please suggest if there's standard way in HU localization or how was it achieved via non-standard approach? We would like to avoid modification of standard ACR report.

Thanks

AG

entry.title: Connecting to API via Public IP ‚Äì Disabling SSL Validation in CPI
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I‚Äôm trying to connect to an API that doesn‚Äôt have a domain and we‚Äôre accessing it directly via its public IP as the hostname. While the connection works fine in Postman, we keep running into errors when calling it from SAP CPI.

"java.net.ConnectException: PKIX path building failed: sun.security.provider.certpath.SunCertPathBuilderException: unable to find valid certification path to requested target, cause: sun.security.provider.certpath.SunCertPathBuilderException: unable to find valid certification path to requested target."

It has been suggested that disabling SSL validation, similar to using curl -k <url>, might resolve the issue.

Has anyone faced a similar scenario in CPI? How did you handle it? Any guidance, suggestions, or best practices would be highly appreciated!

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: Re: Splitting quantities across bins
entry.content:
Hi @beata_d 

It depends on what your goal is; if your goal is to allow mixed storage for the same material with different batches and you still want to keep the standard bin-splitting behaviour, then yes /SCWM/EX_CORE_PTS_MIX is a better fit in your case.

The BAdI lets you control your mixed storage dynamically through the flags MIX_ALLOWED and MIX_CHECK without it overriding the standard logic. Make sure you only use /SCWM/EX_CORE_PTS_NBIN_NRM if you truly need custom bin search logic, else stick with the aforementioned.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: SAP Condition contract Final settlement question
entry.content:
Perform the below steps

RES2 is designed to deduct previously settled amounts during final settlement. Ensure RES2 is active in your condition contract settlement schema. Validate that RES2 is correctly determined during final settlement runs.

Use settlement type ‚ÄúFinal Settlement‚Äù with proper flags to include RES2. Ensure the settlement calendar and validity periods are correctly defined so that partial settlements are recognized.

Confirm that partial settlements are posted with correct condition types and are marked as ‚Äúsettled.‚Äù Check that final settlement logic references the same condition contract and condition records.

Run simulation of final settlement to verify how business volume and prior credits are calculated. This helps catch duplicate credits before posting. 

If standard RES2 logic isn‚Äôt sufficient, consider using BAdI BADI_CCM_SETTLEMENT_DOC to customize how prior settlements are deducted.

entry.title: Re: Error during service entry sheet and GRN creation
entry.content:
Hi,

Kindly note that in a service entry sheet, you can also record Consumable Materials, i.e. material items used during the execution of a service and planned together with a service in the reference purchase order (for more details on how to add items of product type group Material (1), see: Consumable Materials in Service Entry Sheets ‚Äì Lean Services).

Be aware that you can only record materials that were planned together with a service in a purchase order.

This means that you have to maintain at least one item of product type group Service (2) in a service entry sheet.

If you only add material items from the purchase order to the service entry sheet, an error occurs and the service entry sheet can't be posted.

  • In case of standard free-text items, you maintain the product type group Material (1) in the purchase order item details.

  • In case of standard items referencing master data, you can use master data of such product types that contain the product type group Material (1).

Please be aware of several restrictions regarding the type of material item that you can add to a service entry.

For more information on the prerequisites and restrictions for service entry sheets, see Requirements for the Creation of Service Entry Sheets - Lean Services and the detailed description of this feature Consumable Materials in Service Entry Sheets ‚Äì Lean Services.

You can define the account assignment for an item in the purchase order or in the service entry sheet. Even if it‚Äôs already defined in the purchase order item, you can change the account assignment in the service entry sheet - with few restrictions.

If the purchase order has no account assignment, you can copy the account assignment from the contract.

For more details about account assignments in the service entry sheet and the restrictions for changing them, see Account Assignment in Service Entry Sheets ‚Äì Lean Services.

Best regards,

SAP Support

entry.title: Displaying BIN on display bin APP, does not show the stock if bin is section managed
entry.content:
Displaying BIN on display bin APP, does not show the stock if bin is section managed. The business need to display the total stock on the top BIN and not require to go individually to each section.

 


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Displaying BIN on display bin APP, does not show the...
entry.content:
Dear SAP Community,

The core issue is that the standard Display Storage Bins app shows stock at the lowest level of detail (Bin + Section), preventing aggregation. To display the total aggregated stock for a top-level Storage Bin, you must use EWM or IM reporting tools that support grouping and summation.

  • Primary Solution: The Warehouse Monitor

The Warehouse Monitor is the recommended tool in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition for robust stock aggregation.

  1. Open the App: Access the Warehouse Monitor Fiori App.
  2. Navigate: Go to the Stock and Bin node and select Available Stock.
  3. Execute: Run the report using your desired criteria (e.g., Warehouse, Storage Bin, Material).
  4. Aggregate: Once the detailed list (showing all Bin Sections) loads, use the standard Fiori features to:
  • Group the results by the Storage Bin field.
  • Sum/Subtotal the Quantity column within those groups.

This APP effectively the total stock for the entire physical bin in real-time.

  • Alternative: Display Stock - Multiple Materials

The Display Stock - Multiple Materials app (Fiori App ID F1595) offers a simplified view that can also be used for aggregation, especially for users focused on Inventory Management (IM) rather than pure EWM operations. Like the Monitor, it provides a list that can be easily grouped and totaled by the Storage Bin field.

entry.title: Re: Sales Order Created via Client Certificate Authentica...
entry.content:
Hello @hemanth_shetty 

Thank you for your follow-up

Adding an SAP-Passport header can assist S/4HANA in recognising the creator as coming from an SAP application instead of a generic external system.

However, it is not a foolproof way to disable Digital Access (DA). Whether a document is classified as Digital Access ultimately depends on its origin, whether from SAP or a non-SAP application, and your contractual terms, not solely on the authentication method.

Useful SAP Documentation References

Help Portal ‚Äî Digital Access (Public Cloud): definition/scope of DA. SAP Help-Manage Your SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition-SAP Digital Access

KBA 2853271 ‚Äî Digital Access License in S/4HANA Cloud: DA applicability in Cloud scenarios. SAP Support Portal-2853271 - Digital Access License in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition from a 3rd-party legacy system

SAP DAAP/Passport material: explains SAP-Passport as the basis for end-to-end attribution and measurability. SAP News Centre-SAP Digital Access / SAP Digital Access

Help ‚Äî User Registration for Digital Access / License compliance (Cloud): how to register/monitor DA usage. SAP Help-Manage Your SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition-User Registration for Digital Access

Hope it helps

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: How to run "local" tRFC via bgRFC? (local: with no destination or 'NONE')
entry.content:
I want to do a "local" tRFC call with modern ABAP 7.58 SP 1.

Here is tRFC in obsolete ABAP:

    CALL FUNCTION 'Z_RFC'
      IN BACKGROUND TASK
*      DESTINATION 'NONE'
      EXPORTING iv_vbeln = iv_vbeln.

In the ABAP documentation of bgRFC, SAP say that IN BACKGROUND TASK is obsolete. ABAP Cloud also introduced bgPF which is built over bgRFC and can be used (available in my on premises system).

With bgRFC, it's mandatory to indicate an RFC destination. Destination empty or 'NONE' is forbidden. I can't use bgRFC without creating a dummy ZZZ destination (corresponding to NONE) which sounds a little bit stupid.

My current solution with bgRFC is to create a dummy RFC destination in SM59 which acts like 'NONE':

" Create 'ZZZ' in SM59 with no target system (current), no language (current),
" no client/mandant (current) and current user 
DATA(lo_destination_rfc) = cl_bgrfc_destination_outbound=>create( 'ZZZ' ).
DATA(lo_trfc_unit) = lo_destination_rfc->create_trfc_unit( ).
CALL FUNCTION 'Z_RFC'
     IN BACKGROUND UNIT lo_trfc_unit
     EXPORTING iv_vbeln = iv_vbeln.

Do you have any idea how I can replace the obsolete code? Is my proposal right, but why is it needed to create a "dummy" RFC destination?

Thanks.

Sandra

entry.title: Building the Bedrock: An Architect‚Äôs Guide to the Perfectly Compliant Portuguese Invoice
entry.content:
(Source: Video created by IA google NotebookLM)

Hello everyone.

This guide breaks down the blueprint for achieving compliance inside your system - starting with the foundation and moving through the critical layers of validation required to ensure a perfect, unbreakable match between the invoice your customer holds, and the data reported to the government via the Saft PT (digital audit file). Any discrepancy between those two records is an immediate red flag.

Phase 1: The Foundation ‚Äì Sequential Numbering (The Document's DNA)

To achieve that necessary "perfect match", everything must start with the document number, which acts as the entire compliant invoice‚Äôs foundation. This is not a random reference but a "super structured system".

Compliance demands that you treat this foundation with extreme rigidity:

  1. Strict Separation: You must "absolutely have separate number ranges" for different document types, including invoices, credit memos, and even reversals. These document types cannot share ranges.
  2. Chronological Order: The system ensures every document has a unique sequential number that follows in strict chronological order.
  3. Series Retirement: A Series (e.g., B001) must be defined for "at least a year," and once used, it is "retired forever".

If this numbering foundation, which the source describes as the document‚Äôs "unique DNA," is flawed, the entire compliant structure "falls apart", and the crucial digital signature simply won't work.

Phase 2: Layered Validation

Once the foundational numbering is in place, we add the two critical layers of official validation: the ATCUD and the Digital Signature.

Validation 1: The ATCUD (The Official Passport Number)

The ATCUD (Unique Document Code) is the first layer of official validation. You can think of it as your document's "official passport number," issued and recognized by the government.

The ATCUD‚Äôs simple purpose is to provide a "single unique identifier" recognized by the tax authority before the document is even finalized. It directly links your internal document series to the government's records.

How to Build the ATCUD:

  1. Register the Series: You register your document series (e.g., B001) with the tax authority.
  2. Receive the Code: The AT gives you back a unique validation code for that registered series.
  3. Final Construction: The final ATCUD is the validation code "stuck together with your document sequential number".

Validation 2: The Digital Signature (The Cryptographic Seal)

While the ATCUD identifies the document series (answering, "What document is this?"), the digital signature guarantees integrity (answering, "Is this document valid and has it been altered?"). You absolutely need both.

The digital signature is a "complex cryptographic hash" that seals the document and proves its authenticity. It works by chaining every document together.

Key data from the invoice‚Äîincluding the document number, date, total amount, and, crucially, the signature of the previous document‚Äîis fed into an algorithm. This process creates a unique signature that links each document to the one before it, making it "impossible to alter or delete a document without breaking the entire chain".

Phase 3: The Final Walkthrough ‚Äì Layout and Presentation

Building the data components is only half the battle; Portuguese law is "just as strict" about how the information is "actually presented on the page". The final printed document has its own set of "non-negotiable rules".

Your final compliant invoice must visibly include:

  • The Specific Document Number Format: This must be a specific three-part format that is not just your internal system number.
  • The ATCUD: This code "has to be on every single page".
  • The QR Code Relationship: The ATCUD must be printed "directly above the QR code" with "absolutely zero space in between". The QR code itself must be located on either the first or the last page.
  • Mandatory Legal Phrase: Every document must include a precise legal phrase, such as "Processed by certified program number 2563/AT," which serves as a declaration that the invoice was generated by legally certified software. The number 2563 is the official certification number the AT gave to SAP S/4HANA.
  • Pagination: Page numbering must use the mandatory "page one of N format".

If you miss any one of these items, the final document fails inspection.

Compliance Checklist and Final Considerations

To ensure you have covered all the essential ground, here is a rapid-fire checklist of the absolute non-negotiables:

  • Correct number ranges are the essential foundation.
  • The ATCUD and the digital signature provide the necessary validation.
  • The layout must be perfect and match the SFTPT data exactly.
  • A critical regulation: You cannot have negative postings in Portugal; all corrections must be made through "proper credit memos".

Finally, remember that regulations cover data consistency over time. Ongoing data governance is necessary to ensure that if you reprint an old invoice, it still displays the original, correct data (like the customer's original address).

Hope you enjoyed this explanation. Feel free to share your thoughts in the Comments!

entry.title: Re: SAC Report Broadcasting - Blog 2 - Live Data
entry.content:
Hi @arpit_porwal  - here are the update. 

You can do schedule publication with Live (Direct) Connection by Selecting the Advance Feature, the advance feature utilizes the SAP Cloud Connector.

Note both Live (Direct) with Advance Feature which uses cloud connector and Tunnel Connection Supports Schedule Publications.

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_ANALYTICS_CLOUD/00f68c2e08b941f081002fd3691d86a7/c1cbf644b0a1434fbb4ea072a0562286.html

The Advance Feature was introduce to use schedule publication by leveraging  the existing Direct (CORS) connection.

The story opening will follow the path of Direct (CORS) setup, only the schedule publication path will happen via Advance Feature (SAP Cloud Connector) which is same as that of Tunnel Connection (SAC--> SAP Cloud Connector--> Backend).

In Tunnel Connection the story opening we follow the path of /lcs/scc/ which is SAP Cloud connector.

Please find the path below :

Direct (CORS) : https://backendhost:port/sap/bw/ina/GetServerInfo?sap-client=<ID>

Advance Connection / Tunnel Connection : https://<SAC Tenant Host Name>/lcs/scc/scheduling/<Connection Name>/sap/bw/ina/GetServerInfo?sap-client=<ID>

Couple of issues / troubleshooting: 

The system and/or the resources are not set properly in SAP Cloud Connector;
The subaccount does not have a unique location id maintained in the SAP Cloud Connector while multiple SCCs are connecting to same subaccount with same Location ID.

Could check the KBA : https://me.sap.com/notes/0002667924

For issues similar to in below threads:

3137235 - "Error: You were not automatically logged on to the remote data source. Please ask your administrator to verify the SAML Single Sign On configuration." in SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) - SAP for Me

3596837 - Error 'You were not automatically logged on to the remote data source. Please ask your administrator to verify the SAML Single Sign On configuration' occurred while creating live S/4 HANA tunnel connection in SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) . - SAP for Me

3047235 - Error "You were not automatically logged on to the remote data source. Please ask your administrator to verify the SAML Single Sign On configuration" encountered when save the tunnel type BW live data connection in SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) - SAP for Me 

In summary : schedule publication with Live (Direct) Connection works by Selecting the Advance Feature, the advance feature utilizes the SAP Cloud Connector. So, CC is mandatory for either you go with Direct or Tunnel connection.

It was seen in the "Reprocess bank statement" app when checking item and its assigned "items to be cleared". Random invoices were assigned due to their payment order number being e.g. 25 and memo line contained text like "payment amount 150,25".

If nothing is found and allocated, then check if parameters are maintained with prefix ZR, as in the note: "704015 - electronic account statement: Interpretation algorithm 029" and documentation in SAP help: https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/918bca53037f408f91a2295d04ac16bc/4dc5efb40c381c36e10000000a42189b.html 

Default SAP-delivered parameters do contain ZR* range in the range "-'ZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZ'.

entry.title: Empowering Performance Reviews: New Business Rule Scenarios in SAP SuccessFactors Performance & Goal
entry.content:
Organizations increasingly expect HR technology not just to capture what has happened but to enforce consistency, drive quality, and automate standard decisions. One way SAP SuccessFactors is moving in that direction is through more advanced rule scenarios in its Performance & Goals Management module. These rules allow admins to dynamically control form behaviors, enforce policy, and automate process routing‚Äîall based on configurable conditions.

In this blog, we‚Äôll explore:

  • What these new rule scenarios are
  • Key capabilities and examples
  • PM Business Rule Scenarios & Configuration
  • The business benefits
  • Best practices/implementation tips

What Are the New Rule Scenarios?

In recent SuccessFactors releases, SAP has introduced enhanced Business Rules / Rule Scenarios that can be used within Performance & Goals (P&G). These allow administrators to set up conditions in performance forms or goal plans that automatically:

‚Ä¢ Change field visibility, editability, or required status of certain fields depending on other values or statuses.  
‚Ä¢ Add additional review steps in a form routing path when specific criteria are met. For example, if a performance rating falls below a threshold, or a manager wants extra sign‚Äêoff.  
‚Ä¢ Dynamically expose comment fields or other sections depending on conditions (ratings, employee type, location, etc.).  

These rule‚Äêscenarios give flexibility and enforce consistency‚Äîensuring that the performance process is fairer, aligned with policies, and reduces manual oversight.

Key Capabilities & Example Scenarios:

  • Conditional Field Visibility: If an employee‚Äôs rating is 'Needs Improvement', make the development plan section mandatory; otherwise, hide it.
  • Conditional Editability / Read-Only: If the performance form has been submitted past due date, then make rating fields read‚Äëonly.
  • Conditional Required Fields: If the role = 'Manager,' then require the 'Manager Summary' field to be filled; else not required.
  • Dynamic / Additional Review Steps: If the performance rating is less than 3, route the form through HR or a second manager for review.
  • Rule-Based Prompting / Comments: If rating > threshold (say 5/5), then show 'Outstanding Performance ‚Äì any supporting evidence?' comment field.
  • Role-Based Visibility & Permission: Users with HR Admin roles have access to view goals/plans beyond their direct reports.

Prerequisites:

  • In the Performance Management Feature Settings admin tool, you've selected the Enable the latest experience of Performance Management forms option.
  • In the Performance Management Feature Settings admin tool, you've selected the Enable business rules for Performance Management option.

Scenario-1

Add Review Steps Upon Form Routing:

When the latest experience of Performance Management forms is enabled, you can configure business rules that add one or multiple steps to the Modify stage of the form. This feature enables you to include additional reviewers based on certain conditions.

The steps that can be added are pre-configured in route maps and marked as Hidden Until Rule Execution. When a form with a hidden step is being routed forward and the conditions defined in the rule are met, the rule is executed, making the step visible on the form. All step types are supported.

You can define conditions for an overall rating, a custom section field, or the total number of skill, competency, or goal ratings that fall into a specific value range. Here is one example of conditions:

  • If Second Level Manager Approval is equal to yes, show an additional review step

Prerequisites:

  • In the Manage Route Maps admin tool, you've configured the steps to be added and marked them as Hidden Until Rule Execution.

  • In the Configure Business Rules admin tool, you've used the Add Review Steps Upon Form Routing rule scenario to create a business rule for the intended form template.

  • In the Assign Rules in Talent admin tool, you've assigned the rule to the Form Routing to Next Step trigger.

Once the business rule is assigned to a template, Admin can launch a form and meet the conditions to trigger the additional steps.

Here I have logged in as a manager and selected Second Level Manager Review is equal to ‚ÄúYes‚Äù

Once you click on ‚ÄúApprove Goals,"  A pop-up will appear to show additional review step details.

Scenario-2

Creating a Business Rule to Change Field Visibility, Editability, and Required Status on Forms:

Create a business rule that sets specific fields on a Performance Management form to visible or hidden, editable or read-only, and required or optional, when certain conditions are met. A common use case is mandating reviewers to provide justifications when they give the lowest or highest rating.

Prerequisites:

  • Enable Generic Objects is selected in Provisioning.
  • Enable the latest experience of Performance Management forms in the Performance Management Feature Settings admin tool.
  • Enable business rules for Performance Management is selected in the Performance Management Feature Settings admin tool.
  • You have the Administrator Permissions>Manage Templates>Form Templates and Comprehensive template configuration for PMv12 permissions.
  • You have the Administrator Permissions>Metadata Framework>Configure Business Rules permission.

You can define conditions for an overall rating, a custom section field, or the total number of skill, competency, or goal ratings that fall into a specific value range. Here are a few examples of conditions:

  • If the Objective Rating is less than 2 comment is non-mandatory
  • If the Objective rating is more than 3 comment is mandatory

In the Configure Business Rules admin tool, you've used the Change Field Visibility, Editability, and Required Status on Forms rule scenario to create a business rule for the intended form template.

In the Assign Rules in Talent admin tool, you've assigned the rule to the Field Change trigger.

Once the business rule is assigned to a template, Admin can launch a form and meet the conditions to trigger the additional steps.

Here, I have logged in as a manager and selected objective rating as 1, and the comment box is optional.

Here, I have logged in as a manager and selected an objective rating of 4, and the comment box is required.

Business Benefits:

  • Consistency and Policy Enforcement ‚Äì Business rules ensure process compliance automatically.
  • Reduced Manual Work & Oversight ‚Äì Rules automate repetitive checks and reduce errors.
  • Improved Accuracy & Fairness ‚Äì Ensures all employees are treated equally under defined policies.
  • Better User Experience ‚Äì Only relevant fields and steps are shown to users.
  • Auditability and Traceability ‚Äì Provides a transparent trail for compliance and audit purposes.

Best Practices & Implementation Tips:

  • Define clear business use cases before building rules.
  • Map out rule conditions, triggers, and outcomes using decision tables.
  • Start small with pilot implementations before global rollout.
  • Involve HR, Legal, and IT stakeholders early in design.
  • Perform robust testing across roles, forms, and scenarios.
  • Document all rules with ownership and purpose.
  • Monitor usage and feedback continuously post go-live.
  • Version control and maintain the change history of rules.

Conclusion:

The new rule scenarios in SAP SuccessFactors Performance & Goals Management mark a major step forward for process automation, compliance, and user experience. By embedding business logic directly in forms and workflows, HR teams can ensure consistent, fair, and efficient performance management across the organization.
Successful adoption depends on thoughtful design, user engagement, and continuous monitoring. When implemented strategically, these rule scenarios can transform the way performance management processes are executed, delivering both operational efficiency and strategic value.

entry.title: SAP Fieldglass November 2025 Release Communication Now Available!
entry.content:
The What's New Viewer on the SAP Help Portal shows the release notes in an interactive and customizable format, allowing for easy navigation through each item. Explore deeper into those items that take your interest, with many visuals and further information to contextualize the changes.

‚ÄòAutomatically on‚Äô is the enablement description assigned to an item, where the change or new feature is available on day one to all users with access to the affected area.

To view these items, first select 2020.11.0.0 under the Release filter to show only November 2025 items. To then identify only the Day 1 ‚ÄòAutomatically On‚Äô items, filter via the ‚ÄòEnablement‚Äô dropdown and select ‚ÄòAutomatically On‚Äô.

Once the table has been filtered, the items can be downloaded into a PDF format. The PDF can contain a maximum of 200 entries. Select PDF at the top right of the page and then Download PDF.

This Release Communication is also available in 39 languages through our new Machine Translation on the fly capabilities. The required language can be selected via the dropdown at the top of the page.

Next Steps

Customers and partners can use the What‚Äôs New Viewer to stay informed, agile and prepare for the upcoming November 2025 Release.

If you have any questions about the information in this document, or the release in general, submit a case through SAP for Me or the SAP Fieldglass Help Center.

Stay up to date through our dedicated November 2025 Release Resources page. Join the SAP Fieldglass Product Success Work Zone for all things SAP Fieldglass!

entry.title: Understanding Account Status in SAP Sales Cloud V2 ‚Äî and Why It Matters
entry.content:
When you open an account record in SAP Sales Cloud V2, one of the first things you‚Äôll notice is a field called Status.
It looks simple, but it actually controls how the account behaves ‚Äî not just inside Sales Cloud, but also when data moves to S/4HANA.

Let‚Äôs unpack it in plain terms.

What ‚ÄúAccount Status‚Äù Means

The Status tells you where an account stands in its lifecycle ‚Äî from being in preparation, to active, to blocked or obsolete.

Here are the standard statuses in SAP Sales Cloud V2 and what they mean in business language:

Status What It Means Typical Business Scenario
In PreparationThe account is still being set up. It might have incomplete details or is waiting for internal validation or approval.A new lead converted to an account, but your master data or finance team hasn‚Äôt approved it yet.
ActiveThe account is fully approved and ready for business. You can create opportunities, quotes, and orders linked to it.A customer you regularly do business with.
BlockedThe account is temporarily suspended due to an issue (credit limit, legal hold, compliance check, etc.). Users can view it but cannot create new business documents.A customer under financial review or with overdue payments.
ObsoleteThe account is no longer in use. It stays in the system for reference but is excluded from new transactions or replication.A customer that closed operations or moved to another entity.

Why This Field Matters to You

From a user‚Äôs point of view, Status affects what you can or can‚Äôt do with an account.

  • If it‚Äôs In Preparation, you probably shouldn‚Äôt create quotes or deals yet ‚Äî the data might still change.

  • Active is your green light for transactions and pipeline activities.

  • Blocked means ‚Äúpause‚Äù ‚Äî you‚Äôll need internal approval before proceeding.

  • Obsolete tells you the account is historical and shouldn‚Äôt be reused.

So when Sales Cloud behaves like it‚Äôs ‚Äúnot letting you pick a customer,‚Äù it‚Äôs often because the account‚Äôs status doesn‚Äôt allow it.

Impact on Data Replication to S/4HANA

Here‚Äôs where it gets important for integration scenarios.

When accounts replicate from Sales Cloud V2 to SAP S/4HANA, the Status directly influences what goes through and what stays behind.

  1. Only Active Accounts replicate to S/4HANA.
    That‚Äôs by design ‚Äî you don‚Äôt want half-complete or blocked customers cluttering your ERP master data.

  2. In Preparation or Blocked accounts do not replicate.
    They stay in Sales Cloud until they‚Äôre approved (status = Active).
    This ensures S/4 only receives validated customer data.

  3. Obsolete accounts are typically treated as inactive in replication.
    If already replicated earlier, changes might not sync anymore. They might need to be archived or deactivated manually in S/4.

  4. Status changes can trigger or stop replication.
    For example, once an account moves from In Preparation ‚Üí Active, it becomes eligible for replication on the next sync run.
    On the flip side, if an Active account becomes Blocked, new updates might stop replicating until it‚Äôs unblocked.

A Simple Example

Let‚Äôs say your sales rep creates a new customer called Greenline Logistics GmbH.

  1. The account starts as In Preparation ‚Äî master data team reviews it.

  2. Once approved, status changes to Active ‚Üí account now replicates to S/4HANA as a customer master.

  3. A few months later, they delay payments ‚Äî finance changes status to Blocked ‚Üí no new orders flow from Sales Cloud.

  4. A year later, the business closes ‚Üí marked as Obsolete ‚Üí record remains for reporting, but is no longer updated or synced.

This simple field keeps your CRM and ERP clean, synchronized, and business-ready.

Best Practices

  • Check before you create: Always verify account status before adding quotes or opportunities.

  • Use filters: Add ‚ÄúStatus = Active‚Äù filters in your account list views to focus only on usable customers.

  • Collaborate: If you see an account stuck in ‚ÄúIn Preparation,‚Äù follow up with your master data or finance team.

  • Understand replication timing: Changes in status might not reflect in S/4 instantly ‚Äî they sync based on your integration schedule.

The Bottom Line

Account Status in SAP Sales Cloud V2 isn‚Äôt just an internal label.
It‚Äôs a gatekeeper for your entire customer lifecycle ‚Äî controlling what your sales team can do and what data makes it to S/4HANA.

Understanding and using it correctly keeps your CRM cleaner, reduces integration errors, and prevents messy downstream issues in finance or logistics.

entry.title: Re: Replacement of string '&3' not possible in CDS View
entry.content:
I reproduced. I think it's a bug.  You can see via the context menu "Show SQL CREATE Statement" that it's completely wrong.

It's related to the character & plus unknown other conditions. It starts to go wrong with the third '&'.

I created one CDS view to define a column AMPERSAND whose value is the constant '&':

define view entity zzsr2_cds_view
  as select from t100
{
  key sprsl as Sprsl,
  key arbgb as Arbgb,
  key msgnr as Msgnr,
      text  as Text,
      '&'   as ampersand
}

I created a second CDS view with CONCAT(ampersand,'1') instead of '&1' and so on:

define view entity ZZSR2_CDS_VIEW2
  as select from zzsr2_cds_view
{
  key Sprsl                as Sprsl,
  key Arbgb                as Arbgb,
  key Msgnr                as Msgnr,
      Text                 as Text,
      cast(
        replace(
            replace(
                cast(replace(
                        replace(Text,
                                concat(ampersand,'1'),
                                Msgnr),
                        concat(ampersand,'2'),
                        Arbgb)
                    as abap.char(73)),
                concat(ampersand,'3'),
                'ABC'),
            concat(ampersand,'4'),
            'DEF')
         as abap.char(76)) as MessageText
}

The second CDS view replaces successfully &1 to &4:

I couldn't find a corresponding SAP note. I could only find some old notes about problematic literals like '%(' (2520242 - ABAP CDS: Using literal '%(' in where condition was not properly handled - SAP for Me)

That would be great if you can contact SAP Support.

entry.title: Re: How to set up multi-currency bank?
entry.content:
Hello @Chanaporn ,

Thank you for the screenshot. This message is standard in S/4HANA Cloud, Public Edition.

The reasons you encountered the error as indicated in the error message

  • Each house bank account in SAP has one account currency. Your bank account is THB.
  • On Post Incoming Payments, the transaction currency must match the bank account currency.
  • Entering HKD on a THB bank account triggers the error.

Two correct ways to post

Money credited to your THB account (no HKD sub-account)

    • Keep the transaction currency as THB.
    • Select the HKD invoice and enter the THB amount received.
    • SAP clears the HKD open item and posts the realised FX difference automatically.

You truly receive into an HKD facility

    • In Manage Bank Accounts, add another bank account under the same house bank with Account Currency as HKD.
    • Post the receipt using this HKD bank account with Transaction Currency as HKD.
    • If your real bank uses one multi-currency number, you can still model separate SAP bank accounts per currency.

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Warehouse management storage bin (Cloud Public Edition)
entry.content:
Dear @jan_gold,

To verify the process, I recommend running Warehouse Inbound Processing (3BR). This process will allow you to verify your required strategy.

Strategy setting is performed in CBC and SAP, depending on your needs in this case free spot.

As an example, here are some options:

  • Define Putaway Control Indicator (104279) in CBC
  • Define Storage Type Search Sequence for Putaway (104731) in CBC
  • Specify Storage Type Search Sequence for Putaway (104733) in CBC
  • Optimize Access Strategy for Storage Type Search (104730) in CBC
  • Create Storage Bins app in SAP
  • Sort Storage Bins app in SAP
  • Warehouse Process Type (104391) in CBC

At the end execute scope 3BR to check if your strategy based on Inboud Delivery->GR-> WT(Warehouse Task) working and system proposes the first eligible free bin.

 Also available Extensibility for Putaway Strategies, more details below:

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/87f9b54f9c4f4e75aff0061860a6589a/d1cbe37558094876b1b07dea4ee55e9d.html

Best Regards

Dawid

entry.title: My Expert Playlist for SAP TechEd 2025 Berlin
entry.content:
TechEd is finally back in Europe, and I couldn't be more excited! This year, I'm going all-in on AI-related sessions.

Yeah, AI again... but hear me out

I know, I know‚ÄîAI is everywhere right now and it's easy to feel like it's overrated. But honestly? I think this is where the real innovation is happening. Not the flashy stuff, but the simple improvements that actually make our business processes better. That's what I'm looking for at TechEd‚Äîpractical innovation from SAP that I can actually use.

Here's what's on my list:

Orchestrating enterprise automation with custom AI agents - AD202
I hope this one will help me build AI agents that actually work (and not just in demos).

How to simplify administration tasks in SAP BTP with Joule - XP101
Anything that can automate my work and make my life easier? Sign me up.

Build custom AI solutions with the generative AI hub - AI100
Call me crazy, but I think future applications will be AI-driven without traditional UIs. This session should show me how.

SAP Business Data Cloud: The path forward for SAP Business Warehouse - DA203
Data is everything when it comes to getting good AI results. This might be the key piece I'm missing.

Building custom AI agents and skills with Joule Studio - AI105
I need to understand how to combine skills with agents properly‚Äîthat's where things get interesting.

Joule for developers: How AI can boost your development in SAP Build - AD100
As a developer, I want to know what Joule can actually do to support my workflow. Vibe coding, anyone?

The AI stack is ready‚Äîare you? The challenge no longer is technology - CT1277
The million-dollar question: Is SAP's AI stack really ready for us? Can't wait to find out. üôÇ

It's not just AI, it's the key to innovation üòâ

Apart from all the AI stuff, I'm also looking forward to:

  • The keynote - expectations are high with Joule Studio just launching and TechEd being back in Europe
  • Community talks - want to hear something SAP won't tell you? Check these out
  • DemoJam - it's back after years (not just because of Covid)! Looking forward to seeing some cool innovations

Let's connect!

entry.title: Re: Unable to create delivery of return sales order in pu...
entry.content:
Hello @AshishTumpally 

The error occurred because the return item has a system status of COST. In SAP S/4HANA Cloud, when the status is COST, it prevents delivery creation by design, which explains the BS051 message ‚ÄúCreate delivery not allowed (Sys. Status Cost).SAP Support Portal-2994466 - Error '"Create delivery" not allowed (Sys. Status Cost, object VB&)' (BS051) when creating an outbound delivery with reference to a sales order - SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

Select the Appropriate Process

Credit-only return (Lean Return, order type CBRE)
CBRE is a lean return used for refunds or credits. It‚Äôs not relevant to delivery. Do not attempt to create a return delivery‚Äîcontinue with the credit memo process. SAP Help Portal-Lean Customer Returns Processing

Physical return required (goods must be sent back).
Use Accelerated Customer Return (CBAR) and set Follow-Up Activity to 0001 Receive into Plant. With 0001, the system creates a returns delivery for you; then you post a Goods Receipt (gr). SAP Help Portal-Logistical Follow-Up Activities

If you‚Äôre already using CBAR but still encounter BS051

Make sure the sales order or item is properly costed. In Public Cloud, ask your Costing user to run the sales-order costing or confirm that the background costing job has finished. When the cost calculation is complete, the status updates accordingly, and you can create the delivery. If issues persist, submit a ticket under CO-PC-OBJ as recommended by SAP.2994466 - Error '"Create delivery" not allowed (Sys. Status Cost, object VB&)' (BS051) when creating an outbound delivery with reference to a sales order - SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

With kind regards

Chuma
